pull.title: Fix checkbox layout in Create Wallet dialog
pull.body:
From https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/20555#issuecomment-747742627:
> 0.21.0rc3 compiled from source, Ubuntu 20.04 + i3: tested mainnet, testnet, and signet. created a descriptor wallet in qt, tested torv3 with addnode, and checked if anchors.dat is created on shutdown and removed on startup.
> 
> I've noticed the "Advanced options" label being cut-off in the wallet creation dialog.

This PR should fix this issue.

repo.name: gui
repo.description: Bitcoin Core GUI staging repository. Please do not fork unless for development reasons.

qt: Align layout of checkboxes

events.body:
This seems to fix it! Thanks.

rc3:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19157360/102587849-d55d3300-410c-11eb-9a2d-2cd9035d7da7.png)


pr155:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19157360/102587788-bd85af00-410c-11eb-86c0-4a762bc2c65c.png)
Shouldn't this be a flexible (stretch layout instead of fixed pixles?
This can be reworked for 0.22, but I think for rc4 we should aim for a minimal fix

> Shouldn't this be a flexible (stretch layout instead of fixed pixles?

The goal of this PR was the minimal fix as @MarcoFalke [said](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui/pull/155#issuecomment-747932196). Besides, the issue has spotted on i3 window manager, and the real problem could be [much deeper](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17153#issuecomment-542354297).
post merge utACK the fix. I missed the rc4 issue or 0.21 tag...
